page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: Our area is chiefly arable farm land, this year growing rape,wheat,broad beans and a variety of cash crops, vegetables and soft fruits.Only one mixed farm rears livestock to any significant degree. Silver End garden village, begun in 1926 by Francis H.Crittall is the only village in the block.Using Bourneville as a model he set out to build a self-sufficient village around his window making factory and his idea still influences the village today. Heron's printing works and John Carr's joinery have added to employment,but with the current recession most people journey beyond the village to work.The recent development of large estates of privately owned houses,has almost doubled the population of the village to 3000.A strong community spirit continues to flourish.
